newsitem.title: JAPAN: SESC says time not yet ripe to urge Nomura penalty.
newsitem.headline: SESC says time not yet ripe to urge Nomura penalty.

text.p: Japan's securities watchdog said on Wednesday that the time was not yet ripe for it to urge the Ministry of Finance to take punitive action against scandal-hit Nomura Securities Co Ltd.

"I cannot talk about our recommendation, which would be based on the outcome of investigations (by Tokyo prosecutors). What I can say now is that we are not planning anything today. It's not time yet," a Securities and Exchange Surveillance Commission (SESC) spokesman told Reuters.

Earlier, Tokyo prosecutors said they had indicted two former Nomura directors for giving 49.7 million yen to racketeer Ryoichi Koike in March 1995 in violation of the Japan's securities and exchange law and the commercial code.
The SESC lacks the authority to take punitive action itself but can recommend that the Finance Minister mete out administrative punishment.
